meanings.definition: Arrange (laws or rules) into a systematic code.
meanings.sent1: The teacher codified the classroom rules into a clear list for the students to follow.
meanings.sent2: The government codified the traffic laws to ensure safety on the roads.
meanings.sent3: The librarian codified the bookshelves in a way that made finding books feel like a treasure hunt.
meanings.sent4: She codified her daily routine, turning it into a well-organized symphony of tasks.
meanings.sent5: The chef codified her secret recipes in a special notebook to pass down to her children.

meanings.definition: To compile or arrange laws, rules, or principles into a code.
meanings.sent1: The team codified the project guidelines to keep everyone on the same page.
meanings.sent2: The committee codified the safety regulations to prevent accidents in the workplace.
meanings.sent3: The students codified their study notes in a way that made studying feel like a game.
meanings.sent4: He codified his thoughts into a structured plan, ready to tackle any challenge.
meanings.sent5: The artist codified her color palette, creating a harmonious blend of hues in her paintings.
